intro: Physostegia pulchella, commonly known as the Indian blanket flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow, often with a distinctive black eye-like spot. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite on the stems and can grow up to 12 inches in length. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Physostegia pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
